comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Hmm, I wonder . . . 

Just recently I managed to identify a Henry King photo, which is almost exactly the reverse view of this one, as being "Anniversary Day" (Australia Day) 26 January 1888, The Centennial.  I wonder if this photo and the others in the series around Circular Quay (and Manly) were taken on the same day?  The crowds of families (not workers) heading between the Quay and the tram terminus up Phillip Street are strikingly similar. As are the telegraph poles (!), vegetation, and shipping.

See notes and comments here -

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2495797591/]
